senses: [{"definition":"(usually capitalized) A follower of Plato, a Platonist.","example":null},{"definition":"A senior member of an academy, college, or university; a person who attends an academy; a person engaged in scholarly pursuits; one who is academic in practice.","example":null},{"definition":"A member of the Academy; an academician.","example":null},{"definition":"A student in a college.","example":null},{"definition":"Academic dress; academicals.","example":null},{"definition":"Academic studies.","example":null},{"definition":"Belonging to the school or philosophy of Plato","example":"the academic sect or philosophy"},{"definition":"Belonging to an academy or other higher institution of learning; also a scholarly society or organization.","example":null},{"definition":"Theoretical or speculative; abstract; scholarly, literary or classical, in distinction to practical or vocational","example":"I have always had an academic interest in hacking."},{"definition":"Having little practical use or value, as by being overly detailed, unengaging, or theoretical: having no practical importance.","example":null},{"definition":"Having a love of or aptitude for learning.","example":"I'm more academic than athletic \u2014 I get lower marks in phys. ed. than in anything else."},{"definition":"Conforming to set rules and traditions; conventional; formalistic.","example":null},{"definition":"So scholarly as to be unaware of the outside world; lacking in worldliness.","example":null},{"definition":"Subscribing to the architectural standards of Vitruvius.","example":null},{"definition":"Study of humanities topics rather than science and engineering.","example":null}]
